group.name: Brussels Entrepreneurship and Innovation Meetup Group

description:
Cultural Creatives are organizing a meetup to kick-off their group.


This meetup will be an opportunity to introduce ourselves, our projects or the most exciting persons/ideas we encountered recently.

The conversation will be moderated by the host who will introduce the vision behind starting this group.


All you need is just to bring your precious self and your curiosity in people and their stories.

The capacity for the event is limited (12 persons only), so it is compulsory to confirm participation in advance. 

Some drinks and snacks will be provided by the host.
name: Kick-off Meetup

group.name: Brussels Entrepreneurship and Innovation Meetup Group

description:
After our kick-off meetup on 30 October, we will have the second meetup on 20 November. We will again be a small group of max 12 persons to facilitate a good conversation.


The meetup is now fully booked! But you may wish to put your name down in the waiting list. If you were registered but will not be able to make it this time, please change your attendance status so that someone else can participate.

It would be great if those who will participate for the first time could read the summary report of the last meeting (posted as a discussion). We will not repeat what we have talked about during that meeting. If you have any question, you are of course welcome to ask.

Secondly, some of you suggested that I send in advance the link of the TED Talk we were supposed to watch together so that we save time during the meeting. I thought that's a good idea and would like to share with you Steven Johnson's talk titled "Where Good Ideas Come From". Entrepreneurs often credit their ideas to individual "Eureka!" moments. Johnson doesn't think it's that simple and shows us how history tells a different story. To watch the 17 minutes video please click <a>here</a>.

If you have time, you can also watch the following videos:

- "How to Make Dreams Real" by Ryan Allis (author of the Startup Guide)

- "Entrepreneurship Rules of Thumb" by Reid Hoffman (co-Founder of LinkedIn)

- "The Lean Startup" by Eric Ries

- "Designing Business Models" by Alexander Osterwalder

Finally, Giovanni, Marquis, Walter and Iliana volunteered to talk about their projects and ideas during this meeting. So each one of them will talk 5 minutes, then we will ask them questions to better understand their projects and give them feedback. I will be facilitating the conversation.

The meeting will be in English.


Drinks and snacks will be served by the host but you may wish to bring your own as well.

I look forward to our conversation on Wednesday.

Best wishes,

Mustafa
name: Co-Learning Lab: How to turn a great idea into a sustainable business?

group.name: Brussels Entrepreneurship and Innovation Meetup Group

description:
Coworking is collaborative working in an inspirational and fun space shared by innovative entrepreneurs. It is a growing phenomenon and a burgeoning industry with 2500 coworking spaces created around the world since 2006.

A good coworking space is not just a nice shared office. It is also a thriving community of change-makers, edge-ryders and creative individuals. Their innovative spirits are captivated by the idea of open collaboration, collective intelligence and serendipity. They care about the social and environmental impact of their actions.

The conversation during this meetup will explore the opportunities created by the coworking movement for entrepreneurship and innovation.

The topic will be introduced by the host, a coworking evangelist, who will also present a draft business model for a new generation coworking; i.e. coworking plus startup incubation. This will be followed by the co-learning lab (participants asking questions and giving feedback on the business model).


The places for this meetup is limited and will be allocated on a first-come-first-serve basis.

As this event is free, participants are encouraged to bring drinks and snacks to share if they wish. The coffee will be sponsored by Oliva with her healthy Organo Gold coffee. 


If you are not familiar with coworking, you can visit http://wiki.coworking.com or watch this video:

http://youtu.be/le0dfcG_jVw

Looking forward to our conversation!
name: How "coworking"­ builds a thriving community of innovative entrepreneurs?

group.name: Brussels Entrepreneurship and Innovation Meetup Group

description:
As soon as people come together, they position themselves consciously or unconsciously towards others. In corporate situations, this interpersonal positioning is often seen as “office politics”. However, people also position themselves in sales and social relationships.

When you know which interpersonal position someone takes, and from which unconscious motivators they operate, you’ll understand their behavior and decisions better, and you’ll be more able to influence their decisions.

Organizational intelligence is about understanding human behavior in organizations. You could look at it as following:

- Cognitive intelligence (being intellectually smart, on your own)

- Emotional intelligence (being smart about social behavior of people close to you)

- Organizational intelligence (being smart about human behavior in an organization)

Organizational intelligence and interpersonal positioning are the heart of success in business. You too can position your reputation and brand image to your liking within the organization.

Once you know how the game of interpersonal and hierarchical positioning works, you will know better what to expect and how to respond accordingly.  

Just like with any game or sports, once you understand the rules of the game and know a few techniques, your chances of success increase significantly.

During this workshop you will:

- Discover the 3 theories about human behavior and how people position themselves

- Gain some practical tools and techniques to succeed in business, accomplish more, build better relationships and have more impact on colleagues and customers

- Gain an objective understanding of your own motivations and positioning attitudes. You’ll receive your Sommer Survey report, especially focused on Organizational Intelligence.

Required preparation:

All participants are expected to complete an online survey before the workshop. This takes about 20-30 minutes. Please complete the survey by 26 January on:

www.sommeryeager.com/survey

Complete the survey in a particular context. This may be your current job, a dream job or a specific future job. You’ll be asked to sort a number of statements in your order of preference. Do this based on your gut feeling - the less you think/worry about it, the more accurate the output.

Bonus package:

The first 5 participants to register AND complete the online Sommer Survey will receive a free copy of "Beyond Office Politics". This e-book provides additional insights and techniques to refresh and further develop your organizational intelligence skills.

All participants will receive a special Organizational Intelligence report, indicating how you position yourself in your team and organization. You’ll also get your full Decision Strategy report, which gives you a complete insight in your unconscious strategy to get to success.

About the facilitator:

Christophe Geerkens is a partner at SommerYeager, an international consultancy organization. He helps individuals and organizations to understand, predicting & influence behavior.

+10 years of experience in coaching, training and change management projects

Business partner of Linda Sommer, senior executive coach and author of the book "Beyond Office Politics"

Co-developer of the Sommer Survey, a psychometric tool to assess how people make decisions and position themselves at work

If you have any questions, you can contact Christophe via phone on [masked] or via email at [masked] 

This meetup is free of charge and will be in English.
name: Organizational Intelligence: Understanding Behavior at Work

group.name: Brussels Entrepreneurship and Innovation Meetup Group

description:
Have you been observing a growing trend of successful corporate employees and managers leaving their comfort zones and taking the risk of being entrepreneurs?

Well, we have ... and we were curious to know why. So we asked two of them, Raf Cuyvers and Sandrine Ramboux, to meet with our group and share their stories. They kindly accepted our invitation and the VIPOFFICES agreed to host us generously.

The meetup will be free of charge but there will be a limited number of seats so please register for the event here at your earliest convenience.

If you are on time, you will be welcomed by a glass of wine graciously offered by Le Vin du Mois. The meetup language will be English.

Here is our two inspiring  speakers:

Raf is 46 years old and lives in Heverlee, near Leuven. He graduated as a Master in Economical Sciences at the Catholic University of Leuven and has an additional Management Degree obtained at Insead. He started his career at Hewlett-Packard in 1992.

Being part of the young talent program, he got the opportunity to work in different areas : financial services, sales (channels and global accounts), product management and marketing. Afterwards, he moved into several local (Sales Manager, Business Unit Manager) and international (Sales Director Northern Europe) management roles before taking up his last position at Hewlett-Packard as the General Manager of the Personal Systems Group for Belgium and Luxemburg.

During the last year of his career at HP, capitalizing on his passion for and experience in attracting and coaching young talent, he co-founded a company called Crossbridge. Crossbridge builds bridges between young talent and employers. In September 2012, Raf left HP to join Crossbridge full time. Today, it’s a small HR company with 5 employees in a growing niche market. 

Sandrine is the Founder and Managing Director of C@rma, an innovative engagement platform recently launched linking Turkish professionals with Civil Organisations for social impact.

Prior to Carma, Sandrine had a 20 years banking experience, having worked in Belgium first in Treasury department as bond trader and then in Merger and Acquisitions, in the Nordic countries covering Paper and Oil corporate firms and finally in Turkey as Head of Structured and Corporate Finance for 3y and Head of Operational Excellence for 2y.

In 2012, she looked how she could use better her skills towards social impact and left her job to create C@rma.

Sandrine is a happy mom of 10y old twin girls and is
living with her family since 2007 in Istanbul.

Sandrine has a Master’s Degree in Business Engineering from the ICHEC (Belgium), a Master of sciences in Tax law (ESSF, Belgium), a Master of laws in European and International Law (Leyden, Nl) and she is a Chartered
Financial Analyst.
how_to_find_us: Located very close to Montgomery metro station.
name: Why did I give up corporate life and become an entrepreneur?

group.name: Brussels Entrepreneurship and Innovation Meetup Group

description:
Spirituality and business - Why talking about spirituality in business is not woo-woo but plain old common sense.

In this talk Veronique Pivetta, a Certified Transformative Coach, will share a definition of spirituality that, when understood and respected, leads to increased productivity, employee satisfaction, engagement and resilience, more innovation and better results across the board.

More info about Veronique: http://veronique-pivetta.com/

The event is generously hosted by the Library. The Library is conceived, designed and operated to be an antidote to the blandness of office life.

The meetup will be free of charge but there will be a limited number of seats so please register for the event here at your earliest convenience.

If you are on time, you will be welcomed by a glass of wine.  

The meetup language will be English.


More info about the Library: http://thelibrarygroup.be/
how_to_find_us: The Library is situated between Avenue Louise and the lakes of Ixelles.
name: Veronique Pivetta's Talk on "Spirituality and Business" @ The Library

group.name: Brussels Entrepreneurship and Innovation Meetup Group

description:
Under the Innovation Union Flagship Initiative, the European Union has recently launched Horizon 2020, its new research and innovation framework programme for the[masked] period.

With a total budget of almost €80 billion, Horizon 2020 is yet the biggest research funding programme the EU ever devised. It features a broad array of financial instruments aimed at supporting public research organisations, universities and also small and medium sized enterprises (SMEs) and larger R&D companies.

Areas of support cover a wide spectrum of topics, ranging from information technologies to food security, from climate change to nanotechnologies, from investment readiness to technology transfer. It also includes access to risk finance dedicated to start-ups and spin-offs.

To maximise international cooperation, Horizon 2020 is open not only to applicants from the EU Member States but to the entire world, and through association agreements, it allows for a very close participation with certain countries. Turkey is one of the associated countries under Horizon 2020.

This information meetup will provide an overview of the different financial instruments and funding opportunities available under Horizon 2020. The meetup will also provide practical information on the application procedures as well as further information on research cooperation, with a particular focus on Turkey. Q&A section will allow participants to pose questions on their tangible ideas and provide them with guidance.

AGENDA

19:00 Welcome by Mr Mustafa Osman Turan, Deputy Permanent Delegate of Turkey to the European Union

19:05 Introduction to Horizon 2020 by Mr Huseyin Kebapci, Director, CX6

19:10 Overview of the Horizon 2020 Financial Instruments by Ms Agata Janaszczyk, Policy Officer, Financial Engineering Unit, Research and Innovation DG, European Commission

19:35 Research cooperation under Horizon 2020: Turkey’s participation by Ms Tania Friederichs, Policy Officer, Science, Technology & Innovation Cooperation with Western Balkans and Turkey, Research and Innovation DG, European Commission

20:00 Practical Information on Horizon 2020 by Mr Huseyin Kebapci, Director, CX6

20:10 Horizon 2020: Let’s make it happen by Ms Marta Truco, Director, Alianza 4 Universidades

20:20 Q&A

20:40 Networking Cocktail

This event is organized in cooperation with the Permanent Delegation of Turkey to the European Union and CX6.

venue.name: Delegation of Turkey to the EU

how_to_find_us: Close to Arts Loi Metro Station and next to Filigranes Bookstore
name: How can entrepreneurs benefit from HORIZON 2020?

group.name: Brussels Entrepreneurship and Innovation Meetup Group

description:
This meetup has been suggested by one of our members, Stephanie Kelly. It looks great! However, all the organizational responsibility belongs to her and her friend Dave Ursillo. Brussels Entrepreneurship and Innovation Meetup Group is just conveying the message. Here is what Stephanie wrote about this meetup:


"Hey guys - thought I would post this event here just in case some of you are also writers :)

A friend of mine, author Dave Ursillo, is going to be in Brussels in a few weeks and will be offering a free Storytelling Meetup for Writers and Artists on Monday, May 26 from 7:00 PM to 9:00 PM. During this workshop, we'll be exploring key themes around our creative goals and communicative struggles, and the "human side" of storytelling, and examining how the stories that we share help to shape the experiences of our lives and businesses, plus so much more. Whether you wish to embody more creativity in your writing, on your blog, in your creative work or in your personal life, you'll discover a lot of new ideas, "Aha!" moments and a supportive and nurturing energy at this event – Dave is a truly exceptional person and author. More information can be found at www.daveursillo.com/create/workshops/eu-tour/

And if you plan on coming it would be great if you would sign up on the Eventbrite page so we have some idea of numbers! http://unapologetically-eu-bruxelles.eventbrite.com/ (thank you :)) The location is close to Metro Yser. Hope you can join us - it will be deep and awesome :)"
name: Free Storytelling Meetup for Writers and Artists

group.name: Brussels Entrepreneurship and Innovation Meetup Group

description:
Our meetup group will be hosted by the Microsoft Centre on 16 June 2014.

Mr Ray Pinto, Senior Government Affairs Manager, will be presenting us the activities of Microsoft in Brussels as well as Microsoft’s leading role in ICT Innovation. 

For a food-for-thought on ICT Innovation, you may wish to read the text of Commissioner Nelie Kroes' most popular speech here.

Our traditional welcome drink will be generously provided by Le Vin du Mois.

We will also have the possibility of networking after Mr. Pinto's presentation.

In a nutshell, a meetup not to be missed!

Warm up with this video about the Kinect Effect...

http://youtu.be/oOtXYTnKWEE
name: Innovation in ICT: Time for a Radical Change Continues?

group.name: Brussels Entrepreneurship and Innovation Meetup Group

description:
This meetup is organized by the European Young Entrepreneurs Society at the European Commission.

They would like to cordially invite you to a miniconference on the subject of overcoming obstacles to entrepreneurship in the European Union. This discussion will focus in particular on funding opportunities available for startups, as well as the tools that Europe has at its disposal to help entrepreneurs in the early stages of setting up a business.

The programme will run as follows:

<a>18:30</a> - Introductory remarks by a member of the European Young Entrepreneurs Society

<a>18:35</a> - Welcoming remarks by Mustafa Osman Turan, Deputy Permanent Delegate - Minister Plenipotentiary at the Permanent Delegation of Turkey to the EU

<a>18:45</a> - Panel Discussion moderated by Huseyin Kebapci, Director of CX6, former Commission official

Panelists:

Edit Herczog - former MEP who initiated the Erasmus for Young Entrepreneurs programme


Els De Clerc - General Manager of Reseau Entreprendre Bruxelles, international network of entrepreneurs

Tom van Dyck - former Unilever Manager, Boston Consulting Group Consultant and current Managing Partner at The Performance Coach

<a>20:00</a> - Q & A Session with the audience

<a>20:30</a> - Networking session with drinks and snacks

<a>21:00</a> - End of the networking session 

See you there!

venue.name: Delegation of Turkey to the EU

how_to_find_us: Near metro station Arts Loi, next to Filigranes bookstore.
name: How Europe can overcome obstacles to innovation & entrepreneurship?

group.name: Brussels Entrepreneurship and Innovation Meetup Group

description:
UNFUZZYING THE FUZZY FRONT END OF INNOVATION

The fuzzy front end is the nickname for the start of innovation. Getting innovative ideas is a vague process which is considered as "hard to do". FORTH helps you to unfuzzy it. During this meetup you will be immersed in the world of FORTH, an innovation method to create attractive innovative products and services with great internal support with a multidisciplinary team.


Unlike brainstorms or hiring external creators to come up with ideas, the FORTH innovation method leads to concrete new concepts, which are attractive because they have been checked at customers and are worked out as mini new business cases. The innovative concepts have great internal support because your employees themselves have ideated them and customers and decision-makers were closely involved in the ideation process.


Join this meetup and be enlightened by probably the best, the most effective & the most successful method for front end innovation.


ON THE AGENDA:


Innovation is essential but difficult: What goes wrong at the start of innovation? 

The essential elements for a successful innovation process


The world of FORTH - 5 stages: why, what and how


• Full steam ahead

• Observe and learn

• Raise ideas

• Test ideas

• Homecoming

FORTH experiences


FOR MORE INFO: www.redzezel.com

Sara Pieters, graduated from the University of Leuven with a master degree in applied economics and an international business economics specialisation and also holds a post-master in applied economics from the University of Leuven.


She worked as a project coordinator for Voka – Chamber of Commerce Antwerp-Waasland. She was responsible for starting up and rolling out various projects, first in the Innovation and Enterprise department and then in the International department.  


In 2006 she joined Flanders District of Creativity. As a Manager International Relations she learned a lot in the field of creativity & innovation. 

In 2011 Sara started her own business (www.redzezel.com) and bring into practice what she learned at Flanders DC: making organisations more creative and discovering the innovation path with them, with a strong focus on people and experiences.

https://vimeo.com/96073158

This meetup will be generously hosted by Transforma Bxl, a coworking space hosting a community of entrepreneurs, innovators and change makers.

This meetup is in English and free of charge. Those who come on time will enjoy our welcome drinks.
name: Jump Start Innovation in Your Organization with Forth Method by Sara Pieters

group.name: Brussels Entrepreneurship and Innovation Meetup Group

description:
FabLabXL - Factory of the Future is an EFRO project supported by Enterprise Flanders by which the Department of Design & Technology at the Erasmus University College Brussels aims to stimulate entrepreneurship in the creative and manufacturing industry .

Specifically , FabLabXL focuses on making physical prototypes in the fablab and on the creation of multimedia content in the medialab.  In the fablab you find machinery such as 3D printers, milling machines, laser cutters, and all sorts of electronics tools to make - almost - anything.  The medialab is equipped with mocap, 3D scanning, greenkey with associated recording equipment and a test lab for mobile applications.

Our host Stijn de Mil will present us where fablabs come from and what they can offer to our technological society - and then focusing more on the entrepreneurial aspect of the European funded project FabLabXL: Fabrication of the Future. This is indeed a chance to see and experience something extraordinary!


For an introduction to the concept of FabLab, you can watch this video:

http://youtu.be/mXdbO4v4sMI
how_to_find_us: In the premises of Erasmus Hogeschool Brussels Department of Design and Technology - Follow the signs
name: Visiting FabLabXL: Factories of the Future

group.name: Brussels Entrepreneurship and Innovation Meetup Group

description:
This meetup has been suggested by one of our members, Alex Coumans. All the organizational responsibility belongs to her and the event host Naomi. Here is what Alex wrote about this meetup:

"A few weeks ago we had a great Storytelling workshop (led by Dave Ursillo) and a few of us had the idea to do a follow-up.

The principle is very simple: We want to get together for some tea (or wine) and cake, and share some of our work. It will give us the opportunity to discuss ideas, talk about possible dilemmas, and motivate each other. So if you are into writing, want to pick it up again, or you have ideas but don’t know how to continue, you are welcome to join! FYI, to join it is not necessary to have attended the previous workshop.

Naomi, who is the host, has kindly enough volunteered to bake cakes. Because we will meet at her house, the number of places available is limited to 8. There are no costs for the event, but it would be great if you could bring something nice to drink. The address will be communicated separately to the attendees."
how_to_find_us: It will be near Botanique metro / tram stop for 92/92. The address will be communicated separately to the attendees.
name: Writer’s get-together - Follow-up to Storytelling meetup

group.name: Brussels Entrepreneurship and Innovation Meetup Group

description:
When people think about ‘Brands’ they often think of the big names, consumer goods, etc.

However, each and every one of us is a ‘brand’ and it’s particularly important to know your ‘brand’ when you’re starting a business or developing an idea, or at whatever aspect of business you’re involved in.

People’s responses to brands – whether they admire them or distrust them – are emotional rather than logical.

Their response is about how the brand makes them feel, what that brand represents, whether it inspires them, whether it gives them what they are looking for, and so on.

Now, your personal brand is no different.

Your brand is your story – it’s about you, your company, who you are, what you stand for, it’s about meaning, purpose, passion and the ‘why’ of your business.’

This is what Helen Kerrison is going to talk about during this meetup which will be hosted by the VIP Offices.


Helen is  a business owner & change agent - entrepreneur and transformation specialist, inspirational coach, business mentor, performance leadership expert, presenter and TV-show host. She is passionate about helping people achieve their absolute best. She is intuitive, authentic, love salsa dancing, have lived in 5 different countries and ran a marathon in 4 hours 6 minutes!

Our second speaker Geoffroy van Lede's talk is titled "I created a business out of my passion." Geoffroy is the founder & manager at Le Vin du Mois. He has broad experience in international companies in the fields of brand building , brand development and business finance.


His talk will be followed by a wine tasting session exclusively prepared by Geoffroy for our meetup participants. 

See you all there on the 2nd of July!
name: Brand Authenticity - "I created a business out of my passion"

group.name: Brussels Entrepreneurship and Innovation Meetup Group

description:
Do you have an interest you are passionate about? Do you wish to reach out to like-minded individuals to share insights and experiences about it? Or are you simply passionate about connecting people through face-to-face conversations? 

You can do all of these either through creating your own meetup group or a subgroup under another meetup group!


For the last 10 months, Mustafa Osman Turan, founder of InnoMate Brussels and InnoMate Istanbul, has gone through a fascinating experience by organizing two meetup groups to connect people in two different cities around the topics of entrepreneurship and innovation. Now he would like to share his experience with you, for two reasons:

- helping you organize your own meetup group or your sub-group
- asking your feedback and support to organize InnoMate meetups better 

Let's brainstorm together and help each other to continue building vibrant communities of change-makers, entrepreneurs and innovators! 

Those who will be on time will enjoy our customary welcome drinks.

Looking forward to seeing you there.

Carolina and Cagri

Your Co-organizers
name: The Art of Hosting Meetups: How Can We Do It Better?

group.name: Brussels Entrepreneurship and Innovation Meetup Group

description:
InnoMate Brussels will be 1 year old on 24 September 2014. It's been a year full of conversations, connections and inspirations.

Together with InnoMate Istanbul, Ankara and Luxembourg, our community of entrepreneurs, innovators and change-makers is fast growing.  

On Monday 8 September, we will celebrate our first anniversary with "After Summer Networking Drinks" generously hosted by the Brussels Representative Office of the Turkish Industry & Business Association (TUSIAD).

Please come and join us for this celebration even if you have never participated in any of our meetups yet. This is a good occasion to get to know each other better!

Prior registration is required. The event is free of any participation fee.

Here is our beautiful venue:
name: After Summer Networking Drinks and First Anniversary

group.name: Brussels Entrepreneurship and Innovation Meetup Group

description:
Gender inequality is especially true in technology. Across Europe, the percentage of women studying in IT related fields averages around six percent. Only 11.2% of top IT roles are women. The area of tech entrepreneurship has a 3% female participation in Belgium. Why are there less women than men in the world of technology? How can we attract and keep female talent in the technology industry?

Bridging the digital divide between men and women represents an opportunity of immense proportions — for women and girls, their families and nations, and the global community. So why are we falling behind in Europe, and what can be done? Listen to real-world discussion of women who are trying to address this gap in Brussels. Here is our panel of speakers:

Afke Schaart heads the EU Institutional Relations Team of Microsoft in Brussels responsible for Microsoft’s engagement with the EU Institutions, Council of Europe and the OECD.  Before joining Microsoft Afke was a former Member of Parliament in the Netherlands and the spokesperson for Economic Affairs and Innovation, Technology and ICT for the People’s Party for Freedom and Democracy (VVD). Prior to that she was responsible for KPN's policy interests and governmental affairs in Europe for almost a decade. She started her professional life at Shell and has studied Political Sciences with a specialization in International Relations in Amsterdam. Afke Schaart was also a Council Member of the Municipality of Wassenaar (the Netherlands) for the VVD. She has been a board member of ECP-EPN, platform for public-private cooperation in the information society. She is a current board member of the E-Society Platform, the European Internet Foundation (EIF) and a member of the Women in Leadership organisation.

Valérie Kinoo, a gender expert, is the cofounder of the Digital Leadership Institute, an organization bridging the gender gap and the digital divide. She is also the cofounder of transforma bxl, a gender-balanced coworking and innovation space in Brussels. In 2014, she co-organized the Women2020 initiative, a high-level public-private sector inquiry into the contribution of women to the Europe 2020 strategy. She has participated in designing events and campaigns promoting gender equality for the European Commission and the United Nations. Valérie holds a master’s degree in International Relations and a master’s in Economics. Previously, she has worked as Cabinet Director for a Brussels local government official (Echevinat) in charge of gender equality.

Monica Hargis, a “serial” entrepreneur, has started up four companies in two continents in her 15 year career. Currently, she is the managing partner of a Brussels-based market research and regulatory consulting group called Marketosis. She has seen first-hand the process of building a company, obtaining angel/early stage seed funding, and eventually selling the company to a major multi-national entity. She is passionate about promoting women in technology and has recently launched a new professional development group aimed at supporting and empowering women leaders in Europe called Women in Technology and Government (WiT-G). WiT-G is designed to bridge the gender gap in technology and government by providing a broad range of support, learning, networking opportunities, and programs to advance and promote women.

Moderator: Mustafa Osman Turan – diplomat, an innovation and entrepreneurship enthusiast, co-founder of InnoMate and InnoCampus.

Program:

18:30-19:00 Welcome drinks
19: 00-19:15 Introductions
19: 15-19: 45 Speakers
19: 45- 20:30 Discussion
20:30-21:00 Networking

Please register soon, as the capacity of our event venue is limited.
name: WOMEN IN TECHNOLOGY – an answer to economic and social challenges

group.name: Brussels Entrepreneurship and Innovation Meetup Group

description:
Cultural and creative entrepreneurs are the heartbeat of the global economy, and essential to the vibrancy of our local communities. They drive global change, create economic value and promote cultural preservation and innovation. They enrich their communities and the world. They generate self-determination and self-reliance. Wherever culture is thriving cultural entrepreneurs are busy building businesses and organizations that express ideas, values, traditions, perspectives - sharing across cultures through markets and commerce.

So, join us for a workshop on cultural entrepreneurship!

18:30-18:45 Welcome drinks

18:45-19:00 Introductions (Carolina & Alex)

19:00-20:00 Workshop (Annick)

20:00-20:30 Networking & drinks

Our inspirational speaker, Annick Schramme, who is the academic director of the Competence Center Creative Industries at the Antwerp Management School, will take us through a think exercise on how best to go about entrepreneurship in the cultural field.

Annick Schramme is at the Antwerp Management School also responsible for the research output of the Knowledge Center of Flanders District of Creativity, and for some education programs (master class cultural management; master class creative jumpers). Furthermore, she is the academic coordinator of the Master Cultural Management and the competence center Management, Culture & Policy (Faculty of Applied Economics) at the University of Antwerp.

Thanks to our sponsors (TÜSİAD and Le Vin du Mois), this event is free of charge but it is required to register on this page in advance.

See you soon!
name: Workshop on Cultural Entrepreneurship

group.name: Brussels Entrepreneurship and Innovation Meetup Group

description:
Dear InnoMates,

Our members Kira and Irene are doing somethin amazing! They have started off the Brussels edition of Fuckup Nights and have ironically proven that talking about failure can be a big success :-) Their first Fuckup Night on 9 October 2014 in Brussels was reported extensively by the national media. This is hilarious as talking about failure by the entrepreneurs in Europe has been a taboo until recently. Thanks to their efforts, this taboo too is now under attack with a smart sense of humor. You can read their story here. 

And now they asked us to invite all of you for their second Fuckup Night. Here is their invitation written by Kira:

"I would like to invite you all to attend FuckUp Night - a monthly event at which three fuckupreneurs present their biggest professional failure.

Talks are delivered in 10 slides of 40 seconds each, with time for Q&A and networking. The crowd is usually filled with smiles and beers. Carolina Correa of Innomates herself gave a (very good!) talk at the first edition in October.

For the November edition we're expecting stories about how (not to) fuck up game development, starting a business among 7 friends and making a printing company 100% sustainable.

The event is on 13 November at 20:30 in the Beursschouwburg in the city center. Attendance is free, but do use the following link to register:

https://funbxlnov.eventbrite.com/

See you all there!?"

Highly recommended!
name: Let's meetup at FuckUp Night!

group.name: Brussels Entrepreneurship and Innovation Meetup Group

description:
The impossible is becoming possible thanks to smart innovations which are bringing everyday objects to life. 

This meetup will dive us into the area of internet of things (IoT): we´ll look into the system behind these innovations, how companies are addressing the challenge of big data and will learn how smart objects will shape our everyday life in the near future. 

Agenda

18:45 – Welcome and Introduction

19:00 – Presentation by Philip Smeuninx (Technical Leader Services at Cisco) about the system behind IoT; 

19:20 – Presentation by Izzet Emre Kayaarma (Client Principal at Hewlett-Packard) on how to address the challenge of big data; 

19:40 – Presentation by Thierry Geerts (Google Country Director) about how IoT will shape our everyday life.

20:00 –  Q&A 

20:30 –  Drinks

From 20:30 you are welcome to visit  the FabLab!

Have a look at this video to get an introduction about the topic.


See you soon!
name: The Internet of Things: bringing everyday objects to life
